com.panacea.sdk.db
Class PMDatabaseHelper

java.lang.Object
  android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      com.panacea.sdk.db.PMDatabaseHelper

public class PMDatabaseHelper
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper

Database Helper to handle all interaction with SQLite DB

Author:
Cobi Interactive

getSubjectCounts

@Deprecated
public java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getSubjectCounts()
Deprecated. 

Returns a list of unique subjects and their respective unread count. This includes "All updates" WARNING: LARGE TASK NOT ASYNCHRONOUS. Rather use CursorAdapter with getCursorSubjectCounts()

Returns:
HashMap of unique subjects and how many unread messages each subject has

getMessagesForSubject

public java.util.List<PMReceivedMessage> getMessagesForSubject(java.lang.String subject)
Returns the latest received message with a given subject for each different thread id. "All updates" will return the latest received message for each subject with a different thread id. WARNING: LARGE TASK NOT ASYNCHRONOUS. Rather use CursorAdapter with getCursorMessagesForSubject(String)

Parameters:
subject -
Returns:
List of latest receivedMessage for each theadID

getMessagesForThreadId

public java.util.List<PMMessage> getMessagesForThreadId(java.lang.String threadId)
Returns a sorted list of received and sent messages for the thread id. Sorted oldest to newest WARNING: NOT ASYNCHRONOUS Rather use CursorAdapter with getCursorMessagesForThreadId(String)

Parameters:
threadId -
Returns:
List of messages in given thread

getCursorSubjectCounts

public android.database.Cursor getCursorSubjectCounts()
Get the Cursor used to display the unique subjects and counts. If no subjects then null is returned.

Returns:
Cursor or null

getCursorMessagesForSubject

public android.database.Cursor getCursorMessagesForSubject(java.lang.String subject)
Get the Cursor used to display Messages for a given subject

Returns:
Cursor

getCursorMessagesForThreadId

public android.database.Cursor getCursorMessagesForThreadId(java.lang.String threadId)
Get the Cursor used to display Messages for a given thread id. This returns PMReceivedMessage's and PMSentMessage's. cursorToMessage(Cursor) can parse this cursor into the relevant message .

Returns:
Cursor

getAllUnreadMessages

public java.util.List<PMReceivedMessage> getAllUnreadMessages()
Returns all received messages that have not been read yet. This is used when displaying notifications. WARNING: NOT ASYNCHRONOUS

Returns:
list of unread received messages

markMessage

public void markMessage(PMMessage message,
                        boolean deleted)
Marks a single message as deleted.

Parameters:
message -
deleted - if true marks as deleted otherwise not deleted

markThread

                       boolean deleted)
Marks all the messages in a thread as deleted

threadID -
deleted - if true marks as deleted otherwise not deleted

                        boolean deleted)

deleted - if true marks as deleted otherwise not deleted

markAll

public void markAll(boolean deleted)
removes the deleted flag from all messages in the database, thereby 'undeleting' them

markMessageAsRead

public void markMessageAsRead(int receivedMessageId)
updates the status of a received message message. AKA marks it as read.

Parameters:
receivedMessageId -

cursorToMessage

public static PMMessage cursorToMessage(android.database.Cursor cursor)
Only used for getCursorMessagesForThreadId(java.lang.String), Where both PMReceivedMessage's and PMSentMessage's are returned in the same query.

Parameters:
cursor -
Returns:
PMMessage
